intro: Sisymbrium orientale subvar. subhastatum, commonly known as the Eastern mustard, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
